mint Package¶

lcls_interface Module¶

Machine interface file for the LCLS to ocelot optimizer

Tyler Cope, 2016

class OcelotInterface.mint.lcls_interface.LCLSDeviceProperties[source]¶

Start the device properties class

get_limits(device, percent=0.25)[source]¶

Function to get device limits. Executes on every iteration of the optimizer function evaluation. Currently does not work with the normalization scheme. Defaults to + 25% of the devices current values.

Args:
device (str): PV name of the device to get a limit for percent (float): Generates a limit based on the percent away from the devices current value
get_start_values(devices, percent=0.25)[source]¶

Function to initialize the starting values for get_limits methomethodd.

Called from tuning file or GUI

Args:
devices ([str]): PV list of devices percent (float): Percent around the mean to generate limits
class OcelotInterface.mint.lcls_interface.LCLSMachineInterface[source]¶

Start machine interface class

errorCheck()¶

Method that check the state of BCS, MPS, Gaurdian, UND-TMIT and pauses GP if there is a problem.

get_alarms()[source]¶

Does not need alarms for now, proabaly dont need this with LCLS MPS.

get_sase(scale=False, seconds=1)[source]¶

Returns data for the ojective function (sase) from the selected detector PV.

At lcls the repetition is 120Hz and the readout buf size is 2800. The last 120 entries correspond to pulse energies over past 1 second.

Args:
seconds (float): Variable input on how many seconds to average data
Returns:
Float of SASE or other detecor measurment
get_value(device_name)[source]¶

Getter function for lcls.

Args:
device_name (str): String of the pv name used in caget
Returns:
Data from caget, variable data type depending on PV
initErrorCheck()¶

Initialize PVs and setting used in the errorCheck method.

init_corrector_vals(correctors, gain, mu=1)[source]¶

Gathers starting values for the correcters/devices.

Args:
correctors ([str]): list of pv names
Returns:
Float list of corrector start values
normalize(corrector, x, gain, mu)[source]¶

Transform to normalized data for optimizer input.

Args:
correcter: pv name of the devices x: the input x val to be normalized
Returns:
Float normalized value of x
record_data(gdet, sigma)[source]¶

Get data for devices everytime the SASE is measured to save syncronous data.

Args:
gdet (str): String of the detector PV, usually gas detector simga (float): Float of the measurement standard deviation
setUpDetector(pvs, detector='GDET:FEE1:241:ENRCHSTBR')[source]¶

Initializes detector parameter to optimize. Usefull for switching desired parameter from GUI.

Default PV is the gas detector: GDET:FEE1:241:ENRCHSTBR

Args:
pvs ([str]): List of PV names detector (str): String of the detector PV name, usually gas detector but can change
set_mu(correctors, gain)¶

Gathers starting values for the correcters/devices.

Args:
correctors ([str]): list of pv names
Returns:
Float list of corrector start values
set_value(device_name, val, num_iters, step, trim=False, updated=False, gain=1, mu=1)[source]¶

Setter function for lcls.

Args:
device_name (str): String of the pv name used in caput val (variable): Value to caput to device, variable data type depending on PV
setup_data_record(pvs)[source]¶

Initializing blank arrays for data storage.

Args:
pvs ([str]): List of pv names
unnormalize(corrector, y, gain, mu)[source]¶

Transform back to to machine units for optimizer output

Args:
correcter: pv name of the devices x: the input x val to be normalized
Returns:
Float un-normalized value of x

lcls_tune Module¶

Example tuning script for LCLS

OcelotInterface.mint.lcls_tune.lcls_tune()[source]¶

Function to launch a simplex scan script on LCLS

mint Module¶

Main Ocelot optimization file Contains the setup for using the scipy.optimize package run simplex and other algorothms Modifiedi for use at LCLS from Ilya’s version
